while I'm sure this is a bit better than the Cams that have been the only source for a while, I need to give a word of warning to those looking for a pristine screener: you will NOT find it here. I appreciate the effort, but this still leaves much to be desired. 
"no jerking" says another commenter. 
well, whatever your terminology, a very apparent stutter is clearly evident here--perhaps the same as the other very recently released screeners for Avatar. and I've tried it on diff. systems and diff. players. I had read the "Vision" release was the best yet, but I'm pretty disappointed. while I'm criticizing, I may as well also say that the cited video kbps seems far lower than what the info below says.

Overall: A: 6.5 V: 4

greenroor, no need for this thread to devolve to the juvenile like so many others on TPB. I watch my dls on a big screen, so perhaps it jumps out more there . . . but if you look w/ discerning eyes you can even see the hiccups on a regular monitor. Yes, it is a slight and intermittent stutter, but it is evident and persistent through almost the whole film. I know there are quite a few "purists" out there, so I wanted to give warning here.
